channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Craig Butt
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Global COVID-19 cases surpass 6.3 million as Australian death toll stands at 102

item.description: If used, Trump would invoke a group of statutes that gives the president power, under some conditions, to activate federal troops for domestic law enforcement.
item.title: What is the Insurrection Act?

item.description: US stocks posted gains overnight as market participants looked past widespread social unrest and pandemic worries to focus instead on lifting lockdown restrictions and signs of economic recovery.
item.title: Wall Street advances on signs of economic rebound

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: The UK has asked Australia to consider sharing the load and accept Hong Kongers in the event of a mass exodus over Chinese suppression.
item.title: UK may ask Australia to give residency to fleeing British Hong Kong residents

item.dc:creator: Julia Naughton
item.description: A guide to bringing yoga into your everyday routine, whether you’re just starting out, looking to improve posture or simply in search of a better night's sleep.
item.title: The stress-busting exercise everybody can do from home

item.dc:creator: Megan Levy
item.description: George Floyd's death at the hands of Minneapolis police has sparked widespread riots in the United States with more than 40 cities in lockdown as demonstrators continue to clash violently with police.
item.title: George Floyd protests LIVE updates: Donald Trump threatens Black Lives Matter protesters with US military as unrest continues to grip America

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: David Key spent his career risking his life to save others. More than 400 times he dangled from a wire under the police helicopter to rescue the helpless.
item.title: Naked City podcast: The Black Saturday hero above

item.description: The White House released details on Tuesday of the leaders' phone call, which included the President extending an invitation to Morrison to attend September's G7 summit.
item.title: Donald Trump invites Scott Morrison to attend G7 summit at Camp David

item.description: "This President today is part of the problem and accelerates it," Joe Biden said, adding that Trump is "consumed with his blinding ego".
item.title: Biden lashes Trump for 'fanning the flames of hate' during protests

item.description: A US federal judge has awarded ownership of the zoo made famous in the Netflix docuseries to Joe Exotic's chief rival.
item.title: Judge gives control of 'Tiger King' Joe Exotic's zoo to Carole Baskin

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: A range of experts have backed the public health response to an apparent false positive COVID-19 result in Blackwater which has caused anger in the community.
item.title: Experts back Blackwater health response after negative test backlash

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: The NRL has blocked Telstra from acquiring its digital rights as it plans for an extension with its free-to-air broadcast partner.
item.title: NRL blocks Telstra from streaming in bid to secure extension with Nine

item.dc:creator: Ross Gittins
item.description: He’s certainly right to believe that the political survival of every government – state or federal – will depend on their success in getting people back to work.
item.title: If Dominic Perrottet cared about jobs as much as he claims, here's what he would do

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: Nearly 60 per cent of residents are living in aged care homes with ‘unacceptable’ staffing levels, research has found.
item.title: 'Unacceptable': 60 per cent of aged care homes understaffed

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Turns out prime ministerial adviser Nico Louw was already reasonably well-known in publishing circles, long before he circulated unauthorised copies of Malcolm Turnbull’s manuscript.
item.title: Political adviser known in publishing circles before circulating Turnbull manuscript

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: Warring parties in the nation's industrial relations battles are being urged to leave their 'wish lists' at the door and find consensus in five priority areas.
item.title: Industrial relations foes urged to 'lay down their arms' as reform meetings start

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Private developer Geocon has defied market jitters and snapped up a high-profile development site in the nation's capital.
item.title: Geocon snaps up $24m site in nation's capital

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Office sales are emerging as the economy comes out of hibernation, with a site at 262 Castlereagh Street set to the test investor demand.
item.title: Office sale to test Midtown demand

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: As the government prepares to unveil its construction stimulus package, the opposition and community housing sector is pushing to include social housing.
item.title: Social housing package proposed as government finalises new home grants

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Wednesday, June 3

item.dc:creator: Nick Galvin
item.description: Amateur singers are missing their weekly fix of music as choirs fall silent amid the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Choral singers fall silent as pandemic shutdown hits community groups

item.dc:creator: Deborah Snow
item.description: The Productivity Commission is urging an overhaul of how Indigenous programs are evaluated, but there is a risk of creating more red tape.
item.title: New national body to evaluate success of Indigenous programs

item.dc:creator: Nathan Ruser
item.description: The Australian government should welcome the brave, young and smart Hong Kong residents who can no longer live in the husk of their city.
item.title: On anniversary of Tiananmen, time for Australia to open its heart again

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: The former prime minister said Chancellor Peter Varghese was presiding over the "shredding" of the university's reputation.
item.title: Kevin Rudd accuses UQ of appearing to 'bend the knee to Beijing'

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: One of Rio Tinto's largest shareholders says the miner's destruction of an ancient site in WA calls into question its commitment to doing what is right, not just what is legal.
item.title: Rio Tinto feels more heat on cave blast as investor pressure rises

item.description: What are we trying to achieve with this extraordinary experiment of superannuation? Senator Andrew Bragg outlines how he would fix the system.
item.title: Book extract: Bad Egg by Andrew Bragg

item.dc:creator: Zoe Bush
item.description: Australians are asking me what they can do about the brutality they are witnessing in the US - the answer is in our backyard.
item.title: Scott Morrison says violence is not the answer: Indigenous Australians have told us what is

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: Australia's economic region faces a wave of instability unless it unites on trade, stimulus and travel, according to prominent former government officials from across the region.
item.title: Coronavirus triggers 'perfect economic storm' for Asia

item.dc:creator: Paul Krugman
item.description: What will Donald Trump and his supporters do if he looks likely to lose November's election?
item.title: 'A terrifying performance': Donald Trump is close to inciting civil war

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: LOGOS Property has cemented its partnership with the Asian giant LF Logistics, developing a new operational site at the $250 million logistics park in Sydney's west.
item.title: LOGOS expands $250m Marsden Park industrial estate

item.description: The underlying causes of anger which culminated in the current widespread protests in America are also lurking in other liberal democratic countries.
item.title: America's problems present far beyond its borders

item.dc:creator: Megan Gorrey
item.description: Waverley Council wants to upgrade the Bronte Surf Lifesaving Club. But surfers say the proposed building looks too large and locals "don't need another Bondi".
item.title: Bigger's not better, locals say: Bronte surf club revamp makes waves

item.dc:creator: Nathanael Cooper
item.description: As Reconciliation Week draws to a close, here are five fantastic First Nations musicians to give a spin.
item.title: Five First Nations musicians to get familiar with

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: Unconditional contracts have been exchanged for the securely leased standalone two-level office building.
item.title: Yarraville office sells for $4.5m

item.description: A full High Court judgment in a legal battle by the people of tiny Murray Island in the Torres Strait was hailed as being of sweeping significance.
item.title: From the Archives, 1992: Court upholds right to native title

item.dc:creator: Andrew Taylor
item.description: Questions have been raised about the management of public land around Sydney Harbour following a federal government review.
item.title: Privatisation fears prompt MP's intervention over 'neglected and unloved' North Head

item.dc:creator: Harry Hollinsworth
item.description: Medicare racket, King Wally fined, Packer back at Nine
item.title: In the Herald: June 3, 1990

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.description: The Trump peace plan not only doesn't prevent a Palestinian state, but may make one more likely.
item.title: Trump can bring peace to the West Bank

item.dc:creator: Tom Cowie
item.description: Barrister Denis Connell has had his security pass blocked while he is investigated for allegedly abusive and drunken behaviour.
item.title: CBD Melbourne: Barrister faces eviction from chambers

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Investors have pumped close to $4 billion into the listed property sector as companies seek to shore up balance sheets bruised by the impact of the global pandemic.
item.title: Arena REIT taps investors as $4b ploughed into listed property

item.dc:creator: Jennifer Duke
item.description: A new government-led default super account linked to the Future Fund and higher contributions for women are part of the senator's plan to overhaul the system.
item.title: 'Drastic surgery': Liberal senator Andrew Bragg's plan for superannuation overhaul

item.description: We are not immune to targeted and racialised policing, and there are ways procedures can be improved.
item.title: 'Stop and search' is a global problem that Australia must also face

item.description: Follow our rolling coverage.
item.title: Tablet interactive: Riots across the US

item.dc:creator: Chip Le Grand
item.description: The university is at risk of going broke in a matter of weeks unless it secures a financial lifeline from the banks and an agreement from staff to cut wages.
item.title: Race to shore up La Trobe University as cash crisis bites

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: The state opposition has urged the Auditor-General to scrutinise coronavirus-related borrowing.
item.title: Victorian Liberals demand audit of state's COVID spending

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Banning gas installation in new buildings and subsidising Victorians to switch to electrical heating and hot water systems would ease the threat of a gas shortage.
item.title: Electric incentives could cut need for more gas drilling, report finds

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: Exporters who wanted to ship 56,000 sheep to the Middle East for slaughter have been refused permission to leave after June 1.
item.title: COVID-19 live export ship banned from sailing in the northern summer

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Wednesday, June 3

item.description: There is an enormous pot of money in government concessions and rebates for concession-card holders, Centrelink recipients and those in financial hardship.
item.title: If you are doing it tough, relief for electricity bills is on offer
